bug.author: amygeorge
bug.description:
Describe the bug Whenever I try to install nlp-architect from scratch, I always run into an issue with the version of tensorflow. To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Follow the directions to install from source pip install -e . get error Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement tensorflow==1.15.2 (from nlp-architect==0.5.3) (from versions: 0.12.1, 1.0.0, 1.0.1, 1.1.0rc0, 1.1.0rc1, 1.1.0rc2, 1.1.0, 1.2.0rc0, 1.2.0rc1, 1.2.0rc2, 1.2.0, 1.2.1, 1.3.0rc0, 1.3.0rc1, 1.3.0rc2, 1.3.0, 1.4.0rc0, 1.4.0rc1, 1.4.0, 1.4.1, 1.5.0rc0, 1.5.0rc1, 1.5.0, 1.5.1, 1.6.0rc0, 1.6.0rc1, 1.6.0, 1.7.0rc0, 1.7.0rc1, 1.7.0, 1.7.1, 1.8.0rc0, 1.8.0rc1, 1.8.0, 1.9.0rc0, 1.9.0rc1, 1.9.0rc2, 1.9.0, 1.10.0rc0, 1.10.0rc1, 1.10.0, 1.10.1, 1.11.0rc0, 1.11.0rc1, 1.11.0rc2, 1.11.0, 1.12.0rc0, 1.12.0rc1, 1.12.0rc2, 1.12.0, 1.12.2, 1.12.3, 1.13.0rc0, 1.13.0rc1, 1.13.0rc2, 1.13.1, 1.13.2, 1.14.0rc0, 1.14.0rc1, 1.14.0, 2.0.0a0, 2.0.0b0, 2.0.0b1) No matching distribution found for tensorflow==1.15.2 (from nlp-architect==0.5.3)
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/RasaHQ/rasa/issues/4782>RasaHQ/rasa#4782</denchmark-link>
Make sure pip is upgraded to pip 19 or above **Environment setup: **
OS (Linux/Mac OS):linux Python version:3.6 Backend:
Additional context

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/amygeorge>@amygeorge</denchmark-link> , please try installing Tensorflow 1.15.2 again, it should work since its a valid release. <denchmark-code>‚ùØ pip install tensorflow== Collecting tensorflow== ERROR: Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement tensorflow== (from versions: 1.13.0rc1, 1.13.0rc2, 1.13.1, 1.13.2, 1.14.0rc0, 1.14.0rc1, 1.14.0, 1.15.0rc0, 1.15.0rc1, 1.15.0rc2, 1.15.0rc3, 1.15.0, 1.15.2, 2.0.0a0, 2.0.0b0, 2.0.0b1, 2.0.0rc0, 2.0.0rc1, 2.0.0rc2, 2.0.0, 2.0.1, 2.1.0rc0, 2.1.0rc1, 2.1.0rc2, 2.1.0, 2.2.0rc0, 2.2.0rc1) </denchmark-code>
